news.headline: India's financial regulator fines Bybit $1M for non-compliance with prevention of money laundering, registration.
news.summary: Bybit, a leading cryptocurrency exchange, has been fined $1 million by India's financial regulator for its failure to register under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act. Consequently, the compliance status of Bybit remains uncertain.

news.headline: Trane Technologies boosts dividend by 12% to $0.94 per share quarterly ($3.76 annually). Payable on March 31, 2025.
news.summary: Trane Technologies plc, a leading global climate innovator, has recently revealed that its Board of Directors approved a 12% rise in dividends. This decision brings the quarterly dividend to $0.94 per ordinary share, equivalent to an annualized $3.76 per share. Shareholders of record on March 7, 2025, are set to receive the dividend on March 31, 2025. The company attributes this increase to its sustainability strategy, robust business operating system, and continuous investment in growth and innovation, highlighting its commitment to delivering value to its investors.

news.headline: Kennametal reported Q2 results: YTD cash from ops $101M (prev. $88M), free operating cash flow $57M (prev. $36M), EPS $0.23, adjusted EPS $0.25. Returned $31M.

Free operating cash flow also saw a significant increase to $57 million from $36 million in the previous year. Earnings per diluted share (EPS) stood at $0.23, with adjusted EPS at $0.25. In addition, around $31 million was returned to shareholders during this period.

news.headline: Plutus Financial Group IPO offers 2.1M shares at $4 each on NasdaqCM, raising $8.4 million. Trading as "PLUT" starting Feb 5.

The Offering consists of 2,100,000 ordinary shares priced at $4 per share, resulting in total gross proceeds of $8.4 million, not including underwriting discounts and offering expenses. The Offering is taking place on a firm commitment basis, with the ordinary shares set to start trading on the Nasdaq Capital Market under the symbol “PLUT” on February 5, 2025.

news.headline: US stock futures likely to open lower due to Alphabet and AMD earnings. Key indices declining with Russell 2000 up. Notable companies reporting earnings. Treasury yields at 4.47% and 4.19%. Fed to likely keep rates unchanged in March. Notable premarket trading decliner ETFs. Tech, Energy, Communication led gains, while Utilities and consumer staples declined. China retaliated, job openings and factory orders declined. Key index performance. BlackRock emphasizing AI investment implications.
news.summary: U.S. stock futures saw a decline post prior advances due to trade war worries and major earnings reports, with three benchmark indices dropping while the Russell 2000 saw a slight increase. Companies including Disney, Qualcomm, Uber, and TotalEnergies are set to report earnings. The 10-year Treasury yield stood at 4.47%, and the two-year yield at 4.19%, with an 83.5% likelihood of the Federal Reserve keeping interest rates steady for March. In premarket trading, the SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust and Invesco QQQ Trust ETF traded negatively. Sectors like Tech, Energy, and Communication Services led the market on Tuesday, with Utilities and consumer staples declining. China took retaliatory measures against U.S. tariffs, impacting trade. Notable stock performances included Spotify and Palantir's positive earnings results. Job openings fell, and factory orders also declined. Key index performances include the Nasdaq Composite rising by 1.35% and the Russell 2000 gaining 1.41%. Analysts at BlackRock are analyzing AI developments for investment insights.

news.headline: Mondelez Q4: Sales $9.6B (3.1% YoY growth, missed est.), EPS $0.65 (missed est.), Cocoa inflation concerns.
news.summary: Mondelez International Inc, a snacks giant (NASDAQ: MDLZ), experienced a drop in premarket trading. The company's fourth-quarter sales grew by 3.1% year-on-year to $9.60 billion, falling short of the analyst consensus of $9.64 billion. Adjusted EPS of $0.65 also missed estimates of $0.66. In specific regions, revenues in Asia, Middle East, and Africa saw a significant increase of 9.9%, while Latin America plummeted by 7.2%. Meanwhile, revenue from Europe and North America rose by 5.8% and 0.1% respectively. Gross profit for the quarter saw a 6.9% increase to $3.71 billion.

news.headline: Stanley Black & Decker reports 4Q & Full Year 2024 results:- Revenues: $15.4B in 2024, 3% down from prior year- 4Q Revenues: $3.7B flat YoY with 3% organic growth- 4Q Gross Margin: 30.8%, up 120 basis points vs prior year- 4Q Adjusted EPS: $1.49- 4Q Free Cash Flow: $565M- Planned cost savings of $2B by end of 2025 to optimize cost base- 2025 Planning Assumptions: Adjusted EPS $5.25 (+/- $0.50), Free Cash Flow $750M (+/- $100M)
news.summary: Stanley Black & Decker announced its financial results for the fourth quarter and full year of 2024. In 2024, revenues were $15.4 billion, down 3% from the prior year. The fourth quarter revenues were $3.7 billion, flat versus the prior year with 3% organic growth. The fourth quarter gross margin was 30.8%, up 120 basis points versus the prior year. Adjusted gross margin for the quarter was 31.2%. Fourth quarter EPS was $1.28 and adjusted EPS was $1.49. The fourth quarter cash from operating activities was $679 million, and free cash flow was $565 million. The company's Global Cost Reduction Program generated $110 million in pre-tax run-rate cost savings in the fourth quarter and has yielded approximately $1.5 billion in pre-tax run-rate cost savings since its inception. They plan to return adjusted gross margins to historical 35%+ levels. Management detailed its 2025 planning assumptions including EPS and free cash flow expectations. Stanley Black & Decker remains focused on driving organic growth, margin expansion, and cash generation to deliver long-term shareholder returns.

news.headline: ATS Corporation reported Q3 fiscal 2025 results: Revenues at $652.0M (down from $752.0M), net income $6.5M (down from $47.2M).

Basic earnings per share stood at 7 cents. All financial figures mentioned in this report are stated in Canadian dollars.

news.headline: Global Bioflocculants market reached US$3,047.0 million in 2024, expected to grow at 6.9% CAGR, reaching US$5,938.2 million by 2034. Key markets include North America (32.5% market share in 2024) and East Asia (23.5% market share in 2024). Market driven by environmental awareness, with Asia-Pacific expected to be high-growth market.bioflocculants offer sustainable alternatives for water treatment and industrial separation.
news.summary: The global Bioflocculants market was valued at US$3,047.0 million in 2024 and is projected to reach US$5,938.2 million by 2034, with a growth rate of 6.9%. This growth is driven by increased environmental awareness and strict regulations in industries, with natural polymers sourced from microorganisms providing sustainable alternatives for water treatment and industrial processes. Industries such as water treatment, food processing, and pharmaceuticals are using bioflocculants due to their effectiveness in removing suspended particles from water, biodegradability, and non-toxic nature. Despite being more expensive than chemical flocculants, the long-term environmental and operational benefits are fueling market growth. Developed economies dominate the market implementation due to stringent environmental regulations, with the Asia-Pacific region expected to be a high-growth market due to rapid industrialization and increased environmental awareness. Key takeaways include a CAGR of 6.9% until 2034, North America expanding at a 7.1% CAGR, and East Asia accounting for 23.5% of the market share in 2024.

news.headline: SunHydrogen achieves highest efficiency for large-area hydrogen module during trip to Japan, collaborates with University of Tokyo and Honda R&D facility.
news.summary: SunHydrogen, Inc. (OTCQB: HYSR) from Coralville, IA, disclosed promising results from recent testing in Japan. The team worked with Prof. Kazunari Domen, Dr. Hiroshi Nishiyama, and Dr. Taro Yamada at the University of Tokyo, as well as visited the Honda R&D facility in Tochigi. The innovative technology creating renewable hydrogen using sunlight and water showed strong performance during the trip on Feb. 5, 2025.

news.headline: Drilling at Leprechaun pit in Valentine Gold Mine, Canada, increases gold by 30%, with 29% more ore tonnes at 1% higher grade.
news.summary: In Vancouver, British Columbia, news is out that Calibre (TSX: CXB; OTCQX: CXBMF) has shared positive updates on additional ore control reverse circulation (“RC”) drill findings from its Leprechaun open pit at the Valentine Gold Mine in Newfoundland and Labrador, Canada. The company wrapped up 21,500 meters of RC drilling with a 9 x 9 meter spacing. The latest results reveal a 29% increase in ore tonnes with a 1% higher grade, resulting in a 30% rise in gold compared to the 2022 Mineral Reserve model for the same area, all at an ore-waste cut-off of 0.38 g/t gold.

news.headline: Board of Directors appoint James G. Kelly as President and CEO of NCR Voyix Corp, replacing David Wilkinson.
news.summary: NCR Voyix Corporation, a prominent provider of digital commerce solutions, announced today the appointment of Executive Chair James G. Kelly as the new President and Chief Executive Officer, replacing David Wilkinson. Kelly's appointment is effective immediately, following Wilkinson's resignation from the role of President and CEO and as a member of the Board of Directors. Kevin Reddy, the lead independent director, has been appointed as the Company's new lead independent director in light of these changes. NCR Voyix Corporation is listed on NYSE under the ticker symbol VYX.

news.headline: Bunge Global SA (NYSE: BG) reports Q4 GAAP EPS of $4.36 vs. $4.18 in previous year; full-year EPS at $7.99 vs. $14.87.
news.summary: St. Louis-based Bunge Global SA (NYSE: BG) released its financial results for the fourth quarter and full-year of 2024. The company reported a full-year GAAP diluted EPS of $7.99 compared to $14.87 in the previous year. On an adjusted basis which excludes certain gains/charges and mark-to-market timing differences, the EPS was $9.19 versus $13.66 in the prior year. For the fourth quarter, the GAAP diluted EPS stood at $4.36 in contrast to $4.18 in the previous year. On an adjusted basis, excluding specific gains/charges and mark-to-market timing differences, the EPS was $2.13 compared to $3.70 in the prior year. The decline in Agribusiness processing results partially impacted the figures.

news.headline: Ionic Mineral Technologies appoints Dr. Wenwei Zheng as Head of Research with 20 years of experience in battery materials, particularly silicon anode development.
news.summary: Ionic Mineral Technologies, a prominent player in cutting-edge battery materials innovation, has appointed Dr. Wenwei Zheng as the new Head of Research. With a substantial background encompassing more than 20 years in materials science, including a notable 8+ years dedicated to battery materials research and commercialization, Dr. Zheng brings a wealth of expertise to the role. His proven track record in driving forward next-generation lithium-ion battery technologies, specifically in the realm of silicon anode development, highlights his capability. This strategic move underlines the company's commitment to staying at the forefront of advancements in the field.

news.headline: US aims to regulate stablecoins, focus on US dollar-backed assets, Trump’s crypto czar David Sacks reveals.
news.summary: The US government, under the administration of Trump, is aiming to regulate stablecoins and transition the market onto American soil. This initiative, overseen by crypto expert David Sacks, primarily targets digital assets backed by the US dollar.
